skos:ConceptScheme.dc:description: This vocabulary contains the Solar Coordinate Systems (SCS) used when describing the vector components of an observed property of the Sun.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: This is a Sun-centered equatorial system where the Z-axis is the solar rotation axis (positive to the North) and its X axis towards the intersection of the solar equator and the solar central meridian as seen from the Earth. The Y-axis completes the right-hand system.

The origin of the system is at the intersection of the solar equator and the central meridian as seen from Earth. The latitude and longitude are given in degrees, with latitude increasing towards the solar North, and longitude increasing towards the solar West limb. The system can be extended to three dimensions by adding the radial distance from the center of the Sun.
